Description: Body sherd of Laconian black-figured pottery kylix; creamy slip; interior: trace of pomegranate border; within, black-figure decoration consisting of male figure, probably Hermes (part of head and pilos cap with added red remaining) to right; exterior: broad band with superimposed red band and lines to either side; tips of rays around, lost, stem.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
See also C. Stibbe, Lakonische Vasenmalerdes sechsten Jahrhunderts v. Chr. Supplement, 213, no. 94.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 115, no. 401, p. 210, no. 401, pl. 84, no. 401)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 240)
Venit 1985 / Laconian Black Figure Pottery in Egypt (p. 396, no. 18, pl. 43, figs. 8-9)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 553, no. E 18, pl. XXXIX, pl. CCLXIII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.63) (phase 3)
